intro: Ptilotus latifolius subsp. chamaecladus, commonly known as the broad-leaved spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its foliage is typically covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions.
